contest-event.event-date:
April 6, 1912 D Halifax Contest (First Section)
Halifax Contest (First Section) 10 Own Choice Test Piece Contest Halifax Contest halifax-contest-first-section
None
Zoo Pleasure Grounds, Halifax, West Yorkshire 1st prize £8,'Halifax Courier' Bowl, set of medals for basses and a new pair of trousers for the conductor, 2nd prize £5, 3rd prize £3, 4th prize £1. 7 bands competed. Source - British Bandsman, April 13, 1912.
April 28, 2012, 6:29 a.m. Sept. 27, 2018, 10:11 a.m.
1 Halifax King Cross Arthur Oakes Pearce Weber [arr. Round]
2 Brighouse and Rastrick Band Joseph Crawford Dyson Rossini [arr. Round]
3 Wyke Jeremiah Holdsworth William Tell [unknown arranger]
4 Lee Mount P. Ambler Les Huguenots [unknown arranger]
Unknown Result Clifton and Lightcliffe Band Fred Berry Wagner [arr. Round]
Unknown Result Sowerby Bridge Subscription Geoffrey Thompson Bancroft Wagner [arr. Round]
Unknown Result Rishworth and Ryburn E. Whiteley Lohengrin [arr. Round]
